docstr: `RADIX` — Base of a model number ### Description `RADIX(X)` returns the base of the model representing the entity `X`. ### Syntax `RESULT = RADIX(X)` ### Arguments ### Return value The return value is a scalar of type `INTEGER` and of the default integer kind. ### Example ``` program test_radix   print *, "The radix for the default integer kind is", radix(0)   print *, "The radix for the default real kind is", radix(0.0) end program test_radix ``` ### Standard Fortran 95 and later ### Class Inquiry function ### See also SELECTED_REAL_KIND
